rounds.comments: (Alex: A category about journalists in the line of fire, we call it...)

clues.text: Ruth Cowan was fired by U.P. for posing as a newspaperman but joined this rival agency & reported on WWII
Seen here, Sean Flynn, son of screen legend Errol, disappeared in April of 1970 during this war
One of the greatest war photojournalists, Robert Capa's "GI Landing on Omaha Beach" was shot at this invasion
Alexander Gardner started out as Mathew Brady's aide & ended up taking one of the last photos of this president
"At Home in the World" is this Wall St. Journal reporter's book published after his death in Pakistan
Marc Brown's son requested a story about an unusual animal, so "Arthur" became this mammal
The professor who created this holiday added an extra "A" as the end to distinguish it from an African festival
Not Moses alone but this brother as well gets the credit for telling Pharaoh, "Let my people go"
Established in 1867, it's America's first fashion magazine
Philippine peninsula which was the site of an infamous "Death March" in WWII
Williams was born on March 26, 1911 in this Mississippi town named for America's discoverer
Richard Burton & Ava Gardner starred in the '64 film adaptation of Tennessee's "Night of" this arboreal lizard
Going to Provincetown to read for Williams helped get Marlon Brando the role of this character
This 1955 play featuring Maggie, Brick & Big Daddy won the Pulitzer Prize
Laura Wingfield lives in a fantasy world populated by her collection of fragile animals in this 1945 play
Married to a muscleman, she isn't an Army brat, but she is a Sargent's daughter
This diva seen here was renowned for her romance with Aristotle Onassis
Carol Lawrence was the original Maria in this Broadway musical
She's seen here on the right with Mary Martin, who played her on stage in "The Sound of Music"
I predict you will name this Russian-born actress who played a gypsy fortune teller in "The Wolf Man"
Prime Ministers Tanaka & Takeshita both resigned as the result of scandals in this country
A 1974 scandal led to the end of Willy Brandt's career as the popular chancellor of this country
Politician John Profumo's 1963 affair with young Christine Keeler discredited the Conservative govt. in this country
In the 1870s, prime minister John A. Macdonald of this North American country took bribes in the "Pacific Scandal"
Former French prime minister Alain Juppe was found guilty of corruption for the misuse of this city's funds
Because of his Hanoverian heritage, American colonists called this monarch "German Georgie" or "Geordie"
Among the more colorful nicknames of this agricultural chemist were "Peanut Man" & "Sweet-Potato Man"
This animal phrase meaning "courageous" was Richard I of England's nickname
He was the "Father of Texas", but the Indians called him "Big Drunk"
This 19th century American politician & orator was nicknamed "The Little Giant"
2 reporters unearth a political scandal that goes all the way to the top in this 1976 film based on a book
Jimmy Stewart played Jefferson Smith, the naive & idealistic appointee to the U.S. Senate in this Capra classic
This political satire starred John Travolta as a Southern governor running for president
Frank Langella is the power hungry chief of staff in this film in which Kevin Kline plays a presidential impersonator
Michael Douglas played Andrew Shepherd, the title character of this film, & even he had trouble dating
On Jan. 31, 1999 this team repeated as Super Bowl champs with John Elway throwing for 336 yards
On January 4, 1995 he was sworn in as the first Republican speaker of the house in more than 40 years
On Nov. 5, 1996, this GOP candidate joked, "Tomorrow will be the first time in my life I don't have anything to do"
In April 1992 riots broke out in L.A. after a jury failed to convict the policemen involved in the beating of this man
Queen Elizabeth II & Francois Mitterrand appeared together at the opening of this on May 6, 1994
clues.response: the opening of the "Chunnel" (the Channel tunnel)

clues.text: This man from Mass. is the ranking Democrat of the Senate's Health, Education, Labor & Pensions Committee
This self-made man has the distinction of being the longest serving senator ever from West Virginia
This Ariz. senator said of Bush's energy plan, "Just one pork barrel project larded onto another"
This Tennessee senator is a practicing physician
This Vermont senator wrote, "You get 15 Democrats together in a room, and you get 20 opinions"

rounds.category: YOU SHOULD BE IN A BALLET!

clues.text: This fluffy skirt that you may have to wear was not named for archbishop Desmond
Your allergy to feathers may prevent you from playing Odette, the queen of the swans in this ballet
To star in this 1890 fairy tale ballet, you shouldn't have spindly legs but you will need a spindle
Your striking resemblance to Kirk Douglas has convinced us to star you in the ballet about this gladiator
Your "Romeo and Juliet" will make everyone forget the 1965 triumph of Rudolf Nureyev & this partner
In this largest country, comrades left & right enjoy coulibiac, a pie made with the spinal marrow of the sturgeon
The Masai people of this African country mix cow blood with milk for a refreshing drink
Sanma aisu is fish-flavored ice cream & taco aisu is octopus-flavored ice cream made in this country
When on this north Atlantic island be sure to try hakarl, a traditional dish of rotten shark
Consisting of a sheep's minced heart, lung & liver, haggis is a specialty of this U.K. country

rounds.text: This film featuring Glenn Ford & Sidney Poitier was the first major film to use rock & roll music on the soundtrack
